individualTaxRates.description: Personal Income Tax rates for individuals (Section 58, Fourth Schedule)
individualTaxRates.note: Tax is calculated progressively - each bracket is taxed at its rate, not the entire income at the highest rate. Applies after relief allowance and exemptions under Section 30(1).
individualTaxRates.exemption: Individuals earning Minimum Wage are exempt (per Minimum Wage Act)

rates.description: Small companies with gross turnover of ₦50 million or less per annum and total fixed assets not exceeding ₦250 million
rates.definition: A company that earns gross turnover of ₦50,000,000 or less per annum with total fixed assets not exceeding ₦250,000,000. Professional services businesses are NOT classified as small companies.

rates.description: All companies that do not qualify as small companies
rates.note: Applies from commencement of this Act

appliesTo: Companies that are constituent entities of an MNE group
Companies with aggregate turnover of ₦20,000,000,000 and above
effectiveTaxRate.note: If effective tax rate is less than 15%, company must recompute and pay additional tax to reach 15%

companyTaxRates.note: Company tax is calculated as a flat rate on total profits

developmentLevy.appliesTo: All companies chargeable to tax under Chapters Two and Three
developmentLevy.note: 4% of assessable profits. 10% of this levy goes to Defence and Security Infrastructure Fund (Fourteenth Schedule)

vat.note: VAT is charged on taxable supplies. Input VAT on services and capital expenditures is fully claimable.

exemptions: Personal chattels under ₦5M or 3x minimum wage
Up to 2 motor vehicles for private use
Shares disposal proceeds < ₦150M and gain < ₦10M in 12 months
capitalGainsTax.note: Individuals pay capital gains tax at their applicable income tax rate. Companies pay 30%.
